item.title: French far-right politician Jean-Marie Le Pen dies at 96
item.description: Le Pen - an unrepentant extremist on race, gender and immigration - founded the far-right National Front in 1972.

item.title: Jean-Marie Le Pen, founder of French far right
item.description: A Holocaust denier and unrepentant extremist on race and immigration, the far-right politician has died at 96.

item.title: Trump seeks to block release of special counsel report
item.description: Lawyers of the US president-elect oppose the release of findings from two abandoned criminal investigations.

item.title: Biden meets exiled Venezuelan opposition candidate
item.description: US President Joe Biden calls Edmundo Gonz√°lez "the true winner" of Venezuela's contested presidential election.

item.title: Tibet earthquake: Scores dead as tremor strikes holy city
item.description: At least 95 people are confirmed to have died in one of China's deadliest quakes in recent years.
